title: Delta Capital appoints Dean of Business School as Board Chairman
text:
17:06 CET Delta Capital appoints Dean of Business School as Board Chairman By MyJoyOnline 
Delta Capital, an investment banking firm based in Accra has appointed Prof. Edward Marfo-Yiadom as Board Chairman. 
Prof. Marfo-Yiadom has in-depth insight in business management and entrepreneurship with several years of experience in academia, research and consultancy. 
He brings in an impressive track record and extensive network in management and finance needed by Delta Capital as the company embarks on growth strategy within the next three years. 
He is tasked to lead the board to provide strategic direction to enable the company achieve its vision to become the preferred investment banking firm in the country. 
We are extremely delighted about his appointment as Prof. Marfo-Yiadom brings in his expertise and extensive experience to our Board, according to Victor Owusu, Chief Executive Officer of Delta Capital. 
Prof. Marfo-Yiadom is currently the Dean of the University of Cape Coast Business School. 
He was Vice Principal of Cape Coast Polytechnic, visiting lecturer at Valley View University and consultant with Capital Consulting Limited and Business Advisory Center in Cape Coast. 
He has written numerous books, journals and articles on management and finance for the academia and business industry. Prof. Marfo-Yiadom is a Chartered Accountant and a member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants, Ghana (ICAG). 
Delta Capital is licensed and regulated by Securities and Exchange Commission of Ghana. The company undertakes management of institutional and high net wealth funds. It also provides corporate finance and advisory services including raising capital for institutions. 
Story by Ghana/Myjoyonline.com
